comments:
2016 Teen Tournament quarterfinal game 5.

From DAR Constitution Hall in Washington, D.C.

clues.clue: This doctor specializes in children & their diseases
Not the automated kind but the human kind, it's a clerk at a bank window
An actuary deals with this hazardous possibility, also the name of a world-conquering Hasbro game
This type of officer doesn't work for the military but helps people get money for cars & mortgages at the bank
Despite the name, those in this job don't go door-to-door asking questions; they ascertain property boundaries
This nation sings, "Send her victorious, happy & glorious, long to reign over us"
This huge country boasts, "From the southern seas to the polar realm, our forests & fields stretch"
The anthem of this country says, "Thy name rouses the hearts of Punjab, Sind, Gujarat & Maratha"
"Beneath our radiant Southern Cross, we'll...make this commonwealth of ours renowned of all the lands"
Andorra's anthem is about this ruler & says the country is "the only remaining daughter of the Carolingian Empire"
The cardboard item around the coffee cup can be called a zarf, or this, like part of your jacket
This verb for breaking into a computer morphed into a noun for a clever solution to a tricky problem
If you want a pal to tell the truth, you may use the abbreviation S.O.O.F., short for this
This 6-letter mash-up word means that you're so in need of food you're cranky
Ariana Grande sang about eyebrows being "on" this, a synonym for "on point" or "flawless"
"Monticello" or "Happiness Pursuer"
"Q-Bert" or "John 2"
"Non-consecutive" or "Uncle Jumbo" (relatives actually called him that one)
"Hermitage Guy" or "The 20"
"Quiet Man" or "X-Mass Gov"
Eating pasta? Thank North Dakota, the USA's biggest producer of the durum type of this, which gives us semolina
Once considered unhealthy, this hog fat has made a comeback; it's high in Vitamin D
The hormone bovine somatotropin is used to increase the production of this
Growers of this nut, the top crop of California's San Joaquin Valley, had no "joy" in being blamed for using too much water
On Angola's flag agricultural work is represented by this large, heavy knife with a Spanish name
In a mind-boggling combo of DNA, this Patriot & his supermodel wife welcomed a baby boy to their family in 2009
How long did it take Hall of Fame voters to go over this Green Bay QB's winning candidacy in 2016? Between 6 & 9 secs.
In 1950 QB Jim Hardy had a record 8 of these turnovers in a 45-7 loss but the very next week, threw 6 TDs
Tim Couch, Brady Quinn, Trent Dilfer & Johnny Manziel are 4 of the 20+ QBs to start for this team since 1999
He won the Super Bowl as a QB in 1999 & as a GM in 2016

(Kelly of the Clue Crew shows a video on the monitor.) In the flash-bang method, after a lightning flash, count until you hear thunder, then divide that number by 5 to find how many miles away the storm is because it takes roughly 5 seconds for this to travel 1 mile
In 2015 a Delta plane's nose cone was damaged & windshields cracked by this type of precipitation
(Jimmy of the Clue Crew shows a video on the monitor.) The warm waters near the Equator are breeding grounds for hurricanes, and as the warm air rises in the storm, this area of low pressure forms
The "Super Outbreak of 2011" is named for more than 300 of these that struck 15 states
Rapidly swirling air over a lake can make one of these: the Itsy-Bitsy Spider knows about the word in another sense
Via blog posts, 15-year-old Jenna narrates this show whose name means "lacking social graces"
Tyler Posey plays Scott McCall, co-captain of the lacrosse team & part of a pack on this MTV series
In September 1984 we aired our first episode of "Jeopardy!" & MTV debuted the awards called these
"Go Big or Go Home" is the subtitle of the latest version of this reality stalwart featuring 7 strangers
MTV ventured into the fantasy realm with these "Chronicles" that find a demon army trying to destroy the Four Lands
He's a tribute for District 12 in the Hunger Games & becomes Katniss Everdeen's love interest & main ally
This beloved children's character said, "The only reason for making honey is so as I can eat it"
This Dickens orphan takes pickpocketing lessons from the Artful Dodger but gets caught the 1st time he tries it
In a Victoria Aveyard series, Mare Barrow is this "colorful" title character who fights the Silver Bloods
In the book "The Hunchback of Notre Dame", this gypsy is hanged; in the Disney film, she lives
Read about black codes & scalawags at the ushistory.org unit on this post-Civil War era
At Bozeman Biology, you can "learn by" or learn about this process of fluid diffusion through a membrane
Michael Hart started e-books & Project Gutenberg when he typed this famous document into a computer on July 4, 1971
At goodreads.com, you can preview books like the tale of prejudice & memory, "Snow Falling on" these
codecademy.com has a section on "HTML &" this 3-letter mechanism for adding color & style to web pages
To totally nail a test or a golf hole
To take on a new cause or a new kid
To stop a mission before it is completed
To detest
It means "to attach" & contains a synonym for "to repair"
The backs of 3 state quarters--Montana, North Dakota, and Kansas--feature parts of this critter
She is on the back of Alabama's quarter; her name is there in English & in Braille
One of these always-at-the-ready soldiers is on the Massachusetts quarter
This 1862 act that granted 160-acre parcels of land is commemorated by a national monument & a quarter back
An America the Beautiful quarter depicts General Burgoyne surrendering his sword in this 1777 battle

final_jeopardy.clue: The symbols for 6 chemical elements spell out his name, beginning with cobalt, phosphorus & erbium
